snippet: The chef Wylie Dufresne is changing the entire menu at his groundbreaking restaurant WD-50.
abstract: Wylie Dufresne, a chef whose entire career has been built on exploration, theory and risk, now plans to change the entire menu of his groundbreaking Manhattan restaurant WD-50. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: WYLIE DUFRESNE slid into a booth the other day at WD-50, his trailblazing restaurant on the Lower East Side, and started talking about science. Specifically, about something called a Faraday cage. A Faraday cage, the chef explained, is a chamber engineered so that its interior is impervious to a surge of electricity. As conceived in the 19th century by a boundlessly curious Englishman named Michael Faraday, the cage could be a safe haven while trees, say, were being spit-roasted a few yards away.
